discourse_list.title: DoI - Off-chain Asset backed lender to onboard Real World Assets - Extended Q&A

content.content: As a follow-up to the MIP13c3-SP4 DoI thread and the associated MIP21,  I am scheduling two calls this week to walkthrough the MIPs and have an extended Q&A with anyone in the community. While you are welcome to attend both, the objective with having two calls is to accommodate for expected scheduling conflicts for many in the community. The objective is a robust discussion into the legal structures, the money flow, the secured nature of the transaction(s), how this can scale, and of course the underlying projects and business model (and specifically why it is a good fit for MakerDAO with regard to risk profile). Tenatative Agenda  Background on being an off-chain lender (e.g. differences between secured and unsecured) - 10 minutes  30,000 ft overview of the proposal and the business behind it - 15 minutes  Detailed step by step of the MIP - 20 minutes  Extended Q&A - however long the community wants to keep asking questions   Scheduling Conference calls are being schedule after both the community call on Tuesday and after the governance call on Thursday. Zoom Join us via Zoom Meeting ID: 863 1227 6278 Each meeting is planned to be recorded. The recordings will subsequently be shared in this thread thereafter.
content.GPT-summary: The author of a proposal is scheduling two calls to discuss and answer questions about their MIP13c3-SP4 DoI thread and associated MIP21. The calls will cover legal structures, money flow, scalability, and the business model behind the proposal. The author will also provide a detailed step-by-step explanation of the MIP. The meetings will be recorded and shared in the thread. The post mainly falls under the category of 3rd party asking questions about the proposal, but also includes the author explaining the proposal, 3rd party giving constructive criticism, 3rd party or author wanting to collaborate, and 3rd party auditing and reviewing the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

I am scheduling another call this week to answer any additional questions from the community (this one will be right after the Governance call on Thursday). I am planning on a similar agenda as the last cycle (and this time include technical implementation questions).
